Yes, Rutgers University offers language courses for beginners as well as intermediate and advanced levels for several languages, including Spanish. These language courses are designed to help students develop their language skills and prepare them for a study abroad program.

Rutgers offers language courses through its language departments, such as the Department of Spanish and Portuguese Studies, and through its language institutes. Language institutes, such as the Rutgers Language Institute and the Institute for Research on World-Systems, offer language courses for a wide range of languages at various levels, including beginner, intermediate, and advanced.

If you are interested in studying in a Spanish-speaking country but only have a little bit of Spanish knowledge, you may consider taking a Spanish language course at Rutgers before participating in a study abroad program. This would help you to develop your language skills and prepare you for your experience abroad.

In addition to taking a language course at Rutgers, you may also be able to find language classes or programs in the community or through external organizations that offer study abroad opportunities. These classes or programs could provide you with additional language immersion experience and help you to develop your language skills further.

In summary, Rutgers University offers language courses for beginners and other levels for several languages, including Spanish. These language courses can help students prepare for a study abroad program in a Spanish-speaking country. Students should research the available language courses and programs to select the best option for their language learning goals.
